text: the arguments are not specified correctly
<target> or player: target fails to resolve to one or more online players
<target> or player: target is not specified when the command's executor is not a player
Sets the game mode of the specified players
the number of players whose game mode is changed.
Added /gamemode <player> <mode>. The command requires a player and numeric gamemode.
Syntax changed to /gamemode <mode> <player>, where player is now optional (defaulting to the sender) and mode can be a number, or one of survival, creative, s, or c.
Changed the ID for survival mode from 3 to 0, changing /gamemode 3 to /gamemode 0.
/gamemode now displays in the chat the gamemode the player switches to.
The m selector now accepts the standard literal gamemode values and abbreviations, such as a, and adventure, and these may be negated as well (e.g., @a[gamemode=!survival]).
Removed abbreviated forms and numeric IDs.
Functionality is almost equivalent to Java Edition 1.10 usage, except /gamemode can only use Creative and Survival modes.

texts.text:
1 Syntax
2 Arguments
3 Result
4 Output
5 Examples
6 See also
7 History

gamemode <gameMode: GameMode> [player: target]
gamemode <gameMode: int> [player: target]

JE: adventure|creative|spectator|survival
BE: gameMode: GameMode and gameMode: int: int

Specifies the new game mode. Must be one of the following:
survival (can be abbreviated as s or 0 in Bedrock Edition) for survival mode
creative (can be abbreviated as c or 1 in Bedrock Edition) for creative mode
adventure (can be abbreviated as a or 2 in Bedrock Edition) for adventure mode
default (can be abbreviated as d or 5) for default gamemode ‌[Bedrock Edition only]
spectator‌[Java Edition only] or 6‌[upcoming: BE 1.18.30] for spectator mode
"hardcore" is not a valid option for the <mode> argument, as it is technically not a game mode.

JE: <target>: entity
BE: player: target: CommandSelector<Actor>

Specifies the target(s). If not specified, defaults to the player who executes the command.
Must be a player name, a target selector or a UUID‌[Java Edition only]. And the target selector must be of player type.

To put the executing player into creative mode:
/gamemode creative
/gamemode c‌[Bedrock Edition only]
/gamemode 1‌[Bedrock Edition only]

/gamemode creative
/gamemode c‌[Bedrock Edition only]
/gamemode 1‌[Bedrock Edition only]

To put all players into survival mode
gamemode survival @a
/defaultgamemode – sets the initial game mode for players joining the world.
